description: a unique string with no spaces or special characters that will be used as id in the website
the name of the file in the objects directory. Should have extension, no spaces or special characters.
creator/author of the object. Usually given Last, First, with multiple authors separated using semi-colon
date of creation of original object, given in ISO 8601 format
description or abstract of the object
example: Black and white photograph of white pines in forest

description: topics represented in the object, should use a controlled vocabulary. multiple subjects separated by a semi-colon
spatial characteristics of what the object is about, subject-like locations and geographical terms.
a collection or aggregation that the item is part of
ID of object in its original context
general genre of object, following DCMI type vocabulary
medium of the object, usually the digital file type
language used in the object, ISO 639-3
free text description of rights status
a standardized statement URI from http://rightsstatements.org/en/
